Package Model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Canvas
Model.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class Game
extends java.awt.Canvas
implements java.lang.Runnable
This is the main class of the whole program. It starts the entire gameplay and calls methods in order to build the game step by step.
See Also:

      This is the main which starts the whole game by calling getInstance(int test).

    • getInstance

      public static Game getInstance​(int test)
      This method creates a single instance of the Game class by calling the private constructor Game(). If an instance already exists it will just return the existing one. For this implementation the singleton pattern is used.
      Returns:
      the one and only instance of Game

    • setState

      public static void setState​(GameState state)
      To set the game to its state (in-game: Game or menu: EscMenu) in order to display the right window
      Parameters:
      state - which GameState should be set

    • setOnlyState

      public static void setOnlyState​(GameState state)
      Sets the state
      Parameters:
      state - state which should be set

    • getState

      public static GameState getState()
      Getter of the game state.
      Returns:
      the current state of the game

    • setSelectedSaveState

      public void setSelectedSaveState​(int selectedSaveState)
      Setter of the selected game state to set if the player chooses the first, second or third saving slot
      Parameters:
      selectedSaveState - integer to set 1, 2, or 3

    • getSelectedSaveState

      public int getSelectedSaveState()
      Getter of the selected save slot
      Returns:
      integer which can be 1, 2 or 3 depending on the currently seleced save state

    • loadsprites

      public void loadsprites​(int amountRoomsGenerated)
      Adds the images which should be loaded for this level to the array. Calls the method to load the sprites for the level.
      Parameters:
      amountRoomsGenerated - how many rooms should be generated

    • loadspritesOfSavedGame

      public void loadspritesOfSavedGame​(int amountRoomsGenerated)
      Loads the sprites of a saved game
      Parameters:
      amountRoomsGenerated - how much rooms should be generated

    • run

      public void run()
      This is the code which the thread calls and so it is running continually. Methods are called to get all functions recquired to play the game
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable

    • tick

      public void tick()
      Checks in a certain period of time if changes are made and reacts to them. For example it checks if every enemy is dead so it can unlock the doors.

    • render

      public void render()
      This method renders every object-image so it is displayed.

    • winScreenInit

      public void winScreenInit()
      Shows the win screen

    • winScreenRender

      public void winScreenRender()
      Renders the win screen

      Adds the portal to the game.
      Parameters:
      x - x-coordinate of the portal's position
      y - y-coordinate of the portal's position

    • removePortal

      public static void removePortal()
      This method removes the portal from the linked list with all GameObjects

    • changeLevel

      public void changeLevel​(java.lang.String level, int amountRoomsGenerated)
      If the current level is completed the next level has to be loaded.
      Parameters:
      level - which level should be loaded next
      amountRoomsGenerated - how many rooms should be generated
